get.summary: Given a model ID, upload it to Hugging Face.
get.description: Given a model ID, upload it to Hugging Face.

Takes a specific model string that must match huggingface ID to download
This function will not be able to infer out description etc of the model
since it is not in the gallery

Provide a reference to a model in the gallery, and we will download it
from huggingface

You can manually specify a pre-created job_id if you want to track the progress of the download with
a defined job_id provided by the API using /job/createId
Returns the config.json file for a model stored in the local filesystem

Given a model_source and a model_id within that source,
try to import a file into TransformerLab.

Given model_path pointing to a local directory of a file,
try to import a model into Transformer Lab.

get.summary: Display the datasets available in the dataset gallery.

200.description: Successful response. Data is a list of column names followed by data, which can be of any datatype.

schema.title: Response Dataset Gallery Data Gallery Get

get.summary: Fetch the details of a particular dataset.
Preview the contents of a dataset.

parameters.name: dataset_id

schema.description: The ID of the dataset to preview. This can be a HuggingFace dataset ID or a local dataset ID.
schema.title: Dataset Id

parameters.description: The ID of the dataset to preview. This can be a HuggingFace dataset ID or a local dataset ID.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: The starting index from where to fetch the data.
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: The starting index from where to fetch the data.

parameters.name: split

schema.description: The split to preview. This can be train, test, or validation.
schema.title: Split

parameters.description: The split to preview. This can be train, test, or validation.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The maximum number of data items to fetch.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The maximum number of data items to fetch.

200.description: Successful response. Data is a list of column names followed by data, which can be of any datatype.

schema.title: Response Dataset Preview Data Preview Get

get.summary: Download a dataset to the LLMLab server.
get.description: Download a plugin and install to a local list of available plugins

plugin_name: the id of the exporter plugin to run
plugin_architecture: A string containing the standard name of plugin architecture
plugin_params: a string of JSON containing parameters for this plugin (found in plugins info.json)

post.description:
Add an evaluation to an experiment. This will create a new directory in the experiment
and add global plugin to the specific experiment. By copying the plugin to the experiment
directory, we can modify the plugin code for the specific experiment without affecting
other experiments that use the same plugin.

get.description:
Delete an evaluation from an experiment. This will delete the directory in the experiment
and remove the global plugin from the specific experiment.

post.description: Get the contents of the evaluation

get.description: Get the output of an evaluation
